title: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast elected Chile’s next president | Chile | The Guardian
snippet: The ultra-conservative former congressman José Antonio Kast has been elected as Chile’s next president. With more than 99% of polling stations counted, Kast took 58.16% of the vote, against 41.84% for the leftist Jeannette Jara, a former labour minister under the current president, Gabriel Boric.

title: Chile elects far-right José Antonio Kast as next president
snippet: Chile has elected the far-right wing José Antonio Kast to be its next president, after an election campaign that was dominated by themes of security, immigration and crime.

title: Far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast wins Chile’s presidential election | Elections News | Al Jazeera
snippet: Far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast has won a run-off election to become Chile’s 38th president, ousting the centre-left government currently in power.

title: Far-right José Antonio Kast wins Chile's presidential vote | AP News
snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile (AP) — Chile’s ultra-conservative former lawmaker José Antonio Kast secured a stunning victory in the presidential election Sunday, defeating the candidate of the center-left governing coalition and setting the stage for ...

title: José Antonio Kast - Wikipedia
snippet: José Antonio Kast Rist (born 18 January 1966), also known by his initials JAK, is a Chilean lawyer and politician. He is the President-elect of Chile, after winning the 2025 Chilean general election.
